intro: Tillaea pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's tillaea, is a rare and endemic plant native to the coastal areas of southern California. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub with small, fleshy, blue-green leaves that are adapted to the harsh, salty coastal environment. The plant produces delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle beauty to its rocky habitat. Tillaea pringlei thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in association with other coastal flora. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
